description: Replacement of timber door and frame to High Street elevation, installation of new door to rear elevation and installation of plant and extraction system to existing commercial premises (at ground floor)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the Approved plans and Condition 2 drawings:

Drawing no. PL112/3449 dated Nov 2022 - details of acoustic housing for freestanding plant, Revised drawing no. PL200/3449 Revision A - proposed layout plan (amended to provide additional detailing relating to the acoustic housing for the freestanding plant), Revised drawing no. PL110/3449 revision A - proposed elevations (also amended to provide additional detailing relating to the acoustic housing for the freestanding plant), Proposed Ground Floor and Basement Floor Plans drawing no.PL200/3440 Rev A and Acoustic Report revision D
REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with the Acton Town Centre Conservation Area Management Plan (2009), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); 7B, 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and Ealing's Draft New Local Plan (Reg.18) policy DAA

| (A) The external cumulative noise rating level emitted from plant, machinery and equipment, as assessed according to BS4142:2014 with all plant items operating together at maximum capacity, shall not exceed the noise limits predicted by ACP Ltd. in their report ref. 11614 Rev. D, dated 17th November 2022, at noise sensitive facades and amenity spaces at the development site and at neighbouring premises.

(B) Prior to first occupation/use of the hereby approved development, a post installation sound assessment shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The details shall confirm compliance with the noise criteria set out in Part A of this condition and shall include the necessary steps to mitigate the noise. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework 2021 sections 2 and 12, London Plan 2021 policy D14, Ealing's Core Strategy 2012,  Ealing Development Management DPD 2013 policy 7A and Ealing's Draft New Local Plan (Reg.18) policy DAA.

| Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework 2021 sections 2 and 12, London Plan 2021 policy D14, Ealing's Core Strategy 2012, Ealing Development Management DPD 2013 policy 7A and Ealing's Draft New Local Plan (Reg.18) policy DAA.
